content.description: Climb the bolt line to the right of route H.
content.location: The bolt line is at the far right end of the upper Crackstar Lounge ledge.

content.description: Climb up at the base of the small left facing corner using a combination of the crack and jugs out left. Step left on the ledge to the base of a steep, broken crack. Climb on.
content.protection: Small rack. Gear to 3"+ can be placed but is not necessary.
content.location: Follows a crack off of the lower ledge from the base of a small left facing corner at the right end of the upper Crackstar Lounge ledge (between the berry bushes).

content.description: Start at the crack behind the serviceberry bush. Climb up the flakes and cracks to the bolted anchor a the top.
content.location: The middle (roughly) of the main Crackstar Lounge ledge.

content.description: Start below a small roof and clumbly looking corner just to the right of the chimney at the left-hand-side of the Crackstart Lounge left. Climb the bolt line up to the corner and transition out to the face to the left at the ledge with the serviceberry bush. Climb the short friction face and transition to the arete with bolts on the left-hand-side. Â You'll find the crux somewhere on the arete with a tricky move on the face below. There are small down-sloping "ledges" on the routes but with a reasonable belayer they are not a concern.
A challenging mantle leads to fun face climbing. After the roof follow the left most bolt line.
content.location: The first route to the right of the chimney/tunnel. Between D and F.

content.description: Stem, face climbing, butt scoot, or whatever you'd like up the chimney with obvious bolts at the left-hand side of the Crackstart Lounge ledge.
content.location: It is the obvious chimney with bolts up at Crackstar Lounge.

content.description:
One of three routes which leads to the tip of the spearhead. This is the middle route, a straightforward slab climb with no obvious crux.

Typically the third pitch when starting from Doorstep/Spearhead Base.
content.location: Starts on  a small ledge on the right side of the spearhead (near route D, the 5.6 chimney) and cuts up the middle of the face.

content.description: Climb the obvious bolted arete. A bolted anchor exists on the ledge about 10 ft back from the face. A few cams (e.g., C4 0.75-2) could be used to build an anchor a few feet below the first bolt.
content.location: The route begins at left-hand side of the ledge at the base of Crackstart Lounge. Route "C" climbs the middle of the face of this feature whereas route "D" climbs the chimney further to the right. There appears to be com inconsistency between initial guidebook names and information here. Likewise new bolts appear to have been added and there may be an additional line between the chimney and arete. Regardless, all climbing is 5.7 or easier.
